radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is filled with gallstones. There is evidence of pericholecystic edema and enhancement of the gallbladder wall, suggestive of cholecystitis. The common bile duct is nondilated with no intraductal filling defects. No intrahepatic bile duct dilatation. The pancreas demonstrates mild focally fatty change in the head. The liver parenchyma is normal, without focal lesion. The portal vein and hepatic veins are patent. The spleen is nonenlarged, normal adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable. No free fluid. Marrow signal is unremarkable.
